solution_line_template: There are {num_people} co-workers and each of their meals is ${main_meal_cost} so {num_people}*{main_meal_cost} = $<<{num_people}*{main_meal_cost}={total_main_meal_cost}>>{total_main_meal_cost}
They order {num_appetizers} appetizers at ${appetizer_cost} each so {num_appetizers}*{appetizer_cost} = $<<{num_appetizers}*{appetizer_cost}={total_appetizer_cost}>>{total_appetizer_cost}

The meals costs ${total_main_meal_cost} and the appetizers costs ${total_appetizer_cost} for a total of {total_main_meal_cost}+{total_appetizer_cost} = $<<{total_main_meal_cost}+{total_appetizer_cost}={subtotal}>>{subtotal}
A {tip_percent}% tip on the ${subtotal} order is {tip_percent}*{subtotal} = $<<{tip_percent}*{subtotal}={tip_amount}>>{tip_amount}

So the meal is ${subtotal}, the tip is ${tip_amount} and he adds a ${rush_fee} rush for a total of {subtotal}+{tip_amount}+{rush_fee} = $<<{subtotal}+{tip_amount}+{rush_fee}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
